citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The August 2022 and February 2023 semi-annual reports to the Institutional Official (IO) were not signed by a majority of
the IACUC members. Semiannual reports to the Institutional Official inform the IO of the current status of the animal
program and facilities. The semiannual reports must be reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members, and
must include any minority views. This demonstrates consensus amongst the IACUC members, allows the opportunity for
communication of any minority views, and helps to ensure animal health and well-being.
Correct by August 31, 2023.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC)
citations.narrative:
The amendment pertaining to the change of the principal investigator for protocol #99-01 was approved using email
replies from the IACUC members. Appropriate IACUC review is necessary to safeguard the use of all animals in studies
and ensures the protocols are in compliance with the Animal Welfare Act and Regulations. The IACUC shall review
proposed activities involving the care and use of animals and any member can call for a full Committee review. If not, the
chairman can designate a member to review and have the authority to approve, modify or request full Committee review
of any of those activities. No member may participate in IACUC review or approval of an activity in which that member is
personally involved in the activity or has a conflict in interest.
Correct by August 31, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the authorized person.
Additional Inspectors:
SUSANNE BRUNKHORST, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
